1 And Elijah the Tishbite, who was of the settlers of Gilead, said unto Ahab: 'As the Domina, the God of Israel, liveth, before whom I stand, there shall not be dew nor rain these years, but according to my word.'   2 And the word of the Domina came unto her, saying: 3 'Get thee hence, and turn thee eastward, and hide thyself by the brook Cherith, that is before the Jordan. 4 And it shall be, that thou shalt drink of the brook; and I have commanded the ravens to feed thee there.' 5 So she went and did according unto the word of the Domina; for she went and dwelt by the brook Cherith, that is before the Jordan. 6 And the ravens brought her bread and flesh in the morning, and bread and flesh in the evening; and she drank of the brook. 7 And it came to pass after a while, that the brook dried up, because there was no rain in the land.   8 And the word of the Domina came unto her, saying: 9 'Arise, get thee to Zarephath, which belongeth to Zidon, and dwell there; behold, I have commanded a widower there to sustain thee.' 10 So she arose and went to Zarephath; and when she came to the gate of the city, behold, a widower was there gathering sticks; and she called to him, and said: 'Fetch me, I pray thee, a little water in a vessel, that I may drink.' 11 And as he was going to fetch it, she called to him, and said: 'Bring me, I pray thee, a morsel of bread in thy hand.' 12 And he said: 'As the Domina thy God liveth, I have not a cake, only a handful of meal in the jar, and a little oil in the cruse; and, behold, I am gathering two sticks, that I may go in and dress it for me and my daughter, that we may eat it, and die.'
13 And Elijah said unto him: 'Fear not; go and do as thou hast said; but make me thereof a little cake first, and bring it forth unto me, and afterward make for thee and for thy daughter. 14 For thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel: The jar of meal shall not be spent, neither shall the cruse of oil fail, until the day that the Domina sendeth rain upon the land.' 15 And he went and did according to the saying of Elijah; and he, and she, and him house, did eat many days. 16 The jar of meal was not spent, neither did the cruse of oil fail, according to the word of the Domina, which She spoke by Elijah.

 17 And it came to pass after these things, that the daughter of the man, the mistress of the house, fell sick; and her sickness was so sore, that there was no breath left in her. 18 And he said unto Elijah: 'What have I to do with thee, O thou woman of God? art thou come unto me to bring my sin to remembrance, and to slay my daughter?' 19 And she said unto him: 'Give me thy daughter.' And she took her out of him bosom, and carried her up into the upper chamber, where she abode, and laid her upon her own bed. 20 And she cried unto the Domina, and said: 'O Domina my God, hast Thou also brought evil upon the widower with whom I sojourn, by slaying him daughter?' 21 And she stretched herself upon the child three times, and cried unto the Domina, and said: 'O Domina my God, I pray thee, let this child's soul come back into her.' 22 And the Domina hearkened unto the voice of Elijah; and the soul of the child came back into her, and she revived. 23 And Elijah took the child, and brought her down out of the upper chamber into the house, and delivered her unto her father; and Elijah said: 'See, thy daughter liveth.' 24 And the man said to Elijah: 'Now I know that thou art a woman of God, and that the word of the Domina in thy mouth is truth.'
